### Decompose labor share: ###

* Extend De Loecker & Warzynski (2012) methodoloy

* Estimate production function with Wooldridge (2009) methodology

* Decompose labor share into:

 * Product market power,

 * Labor market power,

 * Output elasticity of labor.

Labor share of a firm at a time:

$$ \text{Labor Share} = \frac{\text{Output elasticity of labor}}{\text{Product market power} \times \text{Labor market power}} $$ 

<br>

All of the above terms are firm and time dependent

### Results ###

Revenue labor share: -12.31%

* Output elasticity of labor: -7.2%

 * Explains 70%
 
* Product market power: 5.85% 

 * Still relatively small (1.06)
 
* Labor market power: 2.74%

 * Large labor market power (1.3)
